Prior knowledge distillation techniques are ineffective in producing student models with vocabularies different from the original teacher models because they require the student and teacher models to share the same vocabulary and output space.
answers: While there has been existing work on reducing NLP model vocabulary sizes BIBREF15, distillation techniques cannot utilize these, since they require the student and teacher models to share the same vocabulary and output space. pred: They propose extended middle context for CNNs.

Backoff strategies pass UNK-predicted words through unchanged, backoff to a neutral word, or fall back upon a generic word recognizer trained on a larger corpus.
answers: In pass-through, the recognizer passes on the possibly misspelled word, backoff to neutral word backs off to a word with similar distribution across classes and backoff to background model backs off to a more generic word recognition model trained with larger and less specialized corpus.

Pass-through passes the possibly misspelled word as is, backoff to neutral word backs off to a word with similar distribution across classes and backoff to background model backs off to a more generic word recognition model trained with larger and less specialized corpus.

pred: Additive modification to the objective function is a term that encourages an increase for a specific word along a concept word-group associated dimension.
answers: The cost function for any one of the words of concept word-groups is modified by the introduction of an additive term to the cost function. .
